GLG201.name: The Dynamic Earth
GLG201.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
GLG201.description: Physical and chemical processes related to the past, present and future behavior of the earth system, and the energy systems that drive these processes. A study of the earth's materials, the earth's surface and the earth's interior.

GLG202.name: Geology of Michigan
GLG202.description: Integration of the geological evolution of Michigan with its social and economic development. Field trips are required.
GLG202.prerequisite: Completion of Tier I Writing Requirement
GLG202.restrictions: Not open to students in the Department of Earth and Environmental Sciences or in the Lyman Briggs Earth Science Major or in the Lyman Briggs Earth Science-Interdepartmental Coordinate Major or in the Lyman Briggs Environmental Geosciences Coordinate Major or in the Lyman Briggs Geological Sciences Coordinate Major.

GLG301.name: Geology of the Great Lakes Region
GLG301.description: Geological, physical and chemical processes related to the origin and evolution of the Earth, North American continent, and the Great Lakes environment. Soils, hydrology, Earth structure and materials, geologic hazards.
GLG301.prerequisite: (PHY 231 or PHY 183 or LB 273 or PHY 193H) and (CEM 141 or CEM 151 or LB 171 or CEM 181H)
GLG301.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Department of Civil and Environmental Engineering.

GLG303.name: Oceanography
GLG303.description: Physical, chemical, biological, and geological aspects of oceanography
GLG303.prerequisite: (CEM 141 or CEM 181H or LB 171 or CEM 151) and (PHY 231 or PHY 183 or PHY 193H or LB 273 or PHY 183B or PHY 231C or PHY 241)

GLG304.name: Physical and Biological History of the Earth
GLG304.description: Origin of the Earth. Differentiation of the Earth's core, mantle, and crust. Lithospheric tectonics over geologic time. Origin and evolution of the Earth's hydrosphere, atmosphere and climate. Origin and evolutionary history of biological life. Interactions of life with the Earth's endogenic and exogenic systems.

GLG306.name: Environmental Geomorphology
GLG306.description: Relationships of running water, weathering, gravity, ice, waves, wind, and biota (including humans) to terrain and soils. Evolution of landscapes. Classical and modern interpretations.
GLG306.prerequisite: CSS 210 or GEO 206 or GEO 333 or GLG 201 or GLG 304 or ISP 203A

GLG319.name: Introduction to Earth System Science
GLG319.description: Systems approach to Earth as an integration of geochemical, geophysical, biological and social components. Global dynamics at a variety of spatio-temporal scales. Sustainability of the Earth system.

GLG321.name: Mineralogy and Geochemistry
GLG321.description: Earth materials and their origin, modification, structure, dynamics and history. Crystallography and crystal chemistry, and geochemical properties and processes in mineral crystallization and recrystallization. Analytical identification and characterization of minerals in their lithologic context.
GLG321.prerequisite: GLG 201 and (CEM 142 or CEM 152 or CEM 182H or LB 172) and (MTH 132 or MTH 152H or LB 118)

GLG361.name: Igneous and Metamorphic Geochemistry and Petrology
GLG361.description: Evolution, origin, occurrence and tectonic setting of igneous and metamorphic rocks. Phase relations of igneous and metamorphic systems. Studies of rocks in thin sections. Field trip required.

GLG401.name: Global Tectonics and Earth Structure (W)
GLG401.description: Structural geology, geological and geophysical methods of studying the structure and dynamics of the earth and planets. Plate kinematics and global geodynamic processes, plate margin processes and evolution, marine geology. Field trip required.
GLG401.prerequisite: ((GLG 304) and completion of Tier I writing requirement) and (MTH 114 or MTH 116 or MTH 124 or MTH 132 or MTH 152H or LB 118) and (PHY 183 or PHY 183B or PHY 231 or PHY 231C or LB 273 or PHY 193H)
GLG401.restrictions: Open to seniors or graduate students.

GLG411.name: Hydrogeology
GLG411.description: Source, occurrence, and movement of groundwater emphasizing geologic factors and controls.
GLG411.restrictions: Not open to freshmen or sophomores.

GLG412.name: Glacial Geology and the Record of Climate Change
GLG412.description: In-depth analysis of glacial geology and the record of climate change, with emphasis on North America and Europe. Field trip required.
GLG412.restrictions: Not open to freshmen or sophomores.

GLG421.name: Environmental Geochemistry
GLG421.description: Natural and anthropogenic processes affecting the chemistry of the environment with an emphasis on the water cycle. Equilibria and kinetic balances, biogeochemical cycling, contaminant chemicals, chemical origins, environmental health.

GLG431.name: Sedimentology and Stratigraphy
GLG431.description: Sediments, sedimentary rocks, sedimentary processes, and depositional environments through geologic time. Facies event correlation. Fossils as tools in stratigraphy and environmental analysis. Biostratigraphy, paleoecology and taphomony. Field trip required.

GLG433.name: Vertebrate Paleontology
GLG433.description: Fossil vertebrates with emphasis on evolution and interrelationships of major groups. Modern techniques of identification and interpretation of fossils.
GLG433.prerequisite: IBIO 328 or GLG 304 or IBIO 360 or IBIO 365 or IBIO 384 or IBIO 445 or GLG 434 or FW 471

GLG434.name: Evolutionary Paleobiology
GLG434.description: Patterns and processes of evolution known from the fossil record

GLG435.name: Geomicrobiology
GLG435.description: Geological and microbiological perspectives on microbial activities in diverse environmental settings, including geological change mediated by microorganisms, microbial evolution driven by geologically diverse habitats.
GLG435.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors or graduate students in the College of Natural Science or in the Lyman Briggs College.

GLG440.name: Planetary Geology
GLG440.description: Surficial and internal properties and processes of planets and their natural satellites, asteroids, comets, and meteorites. Origin, composition, structure, tectonics, volcanism, impact phenomena, atmospheric evolution, atmosphere-surface interactions, and history of solar system bodies. Results of recent space exploration programs, projects and missions.
GLG440.prerequisite: GLG 201 and GLG 304 and GLG 321 or approval of department

GLG446.name: Ecosystems Modeling, Water and Food Security
GLG446.description: Impacts of climate variability and change on water availability, food security and global environmental change. Integrated models to identify adaption and mitigation strategies to such changes and to enhance the efficiency of natural resources use.
GLG446.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors or approval of department.

GLG470.name: Solid Earth Geophysics and Geodynamics
GLG470.description: Theory and applications of solid-earth geophysics including geochronology, geothermics, geomagnetism and paleomagnetism, geodesy and gravity, rheology, and seismology.
GLG470.prerequisite: GLG 201 and (MTH 133 or LB 119 or MTH 153H) and (PHY 183 or PHY 183B or PHY 193H or PHY 233B or LB 273)

GLG471.name: Applied Geophysics
GLG471.description: Application of seismic, gravity, magnetic, resistivity, and electromagnetic methods to problems related to engineering studies, mineral and oil exploration, groundwater, subsurface mapping, pollution, and hazardous waste.
GLG471.prerequisite: ((MTH 133 or concurrently) or (LB 119 or concurrently) or (MTH 153H or concurrently)) and ((PHY 184 or concurrently) or (PHY 184B or concurrently) or (PHY 232 or concurrently) or (PHY 232C or concurrently) or (PHY 294H or concurrently) or (LB 274 or concurrently))
GLG471.restrictions: Not open to freshmen or sophomores.

GLG481.name: Reservoirs and Aquifers
GLG481.description: Principles of the origin and evolution of porous media. Porosity and permeability of sediments and sedimentary rocks. Computing techniques for evaluating reservoirs and aquifers. Field trip required.

GLG491.name: Field Geology - Summer Camp (W)
GLG491.prerequisite: (GLG 431 and GLG 361) or (GLG 431 and GLG 401) or ((GLG 361 and GLG 401) and completion of Tier I writing requirement)
GLG491.restrictions: Open to students in the Department of Geological Sciences or in the Lyman Briggs Geological Sciences Coordinate Major or in the Lyman Briggs Environmental Geosciences Coordinate Major. Approval of department.

GLG493.name: Field Studies in Geological Sciences
GLG493.description: Field experiences in solid earth and environmental geosciences within the US and abroad. Field trips required.
GLG493.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors or graduate students in the Department of Geological Sciences or in the Lyman Briggs Environmental Geosciences Coordinate Major or in the Lyman Briggs Geological Sciences Coordinate Major. Approval of department.

GLG498.name: Topics in Geological Sciences
GLG498.description: Selected topics in geological and geoenvironmental sciences supplementing or expanding specific topics, or examining topics not covered in regular courses.
GLG498.prerequisite: GLG 201 and GLG 304 or approval of department
GLG498.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors or graduate students in the Department of Geological Sciences or in the Lyman Briggs Environmental Geosciences Coordinate Major or in the Lyman Briggs Geological Sciences Coordinate Major.

GLG499.name: Independent Study in Geological Sciences
GLG499.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
GLG499.description: Advanced individual study of special topics in the geological sciences.
GLG499.restrictions: Open to seniors or juniors in the Department of Geological Sciences or in the Lyman Briggs Earth Science-Interdepartmental Coordinate Major or in the Lyman Briggs Environmental Geosciences Coordinate Major or in the Lyman Briggs Geological Sciences Coordinate Major. Approval of department; application required.

GLG801.name: Seminar in Geochemistry
GLG801.description: Recent developments in geochemistry, including aqueous, biologic and mineralogic aspects.
GLG801.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Earth and Environmental Sciences.

GLG802.name: Seminar in Geophysics and Geodynamics
GLG802.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
GLG802.description: Applied, solid-earth, and theoretical geophysics, global and regional geodynamics. Plate tectonics, marine geophysics, and polar earth sciences.
GLG802.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Earth and Environmental Sciences.

GLG803.name: Seminar in Hydrogeology
GLG803.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
GLG803.description: Occurrence, movement and composition of groundwater in geologic settings.
GLG803.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Earth and Environmental Sciences.

GLG804.name: Seminar in Paleobiology
GLG804.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Earth and Environmental Sciences.

GLG805.name: Seminar in Petrology
GLG805.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
GLG805.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Earth and Environmental Sciences.

GLG806.name: Seminar in Sedimentology and Stratigraphy
GLG806.description: Recent developments in stratigraphy and deposition, and diagenesis of sedimentary rocks.
GLG806.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Earth and Environmental Sciences.

GLG807.name: Seminar in Structural Geology and Tectonics
GLG807.description: Rock deformation and major lithospheric structure.
GLG807.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Earth and Environmental Sciences.

GLG808.name: Seminar in Planetary Geology and Astromaterials
GLG808.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
GLG808.description: Current topics in planetary geology and astromaterials, including meteorites and returned samples.
GLG808.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Earth and Environmental Sciences. Approval of department.

GLG813.name: Watershed Hydrology
GLG813.description: Watershed hydrology covering the physical, chemical, and isotopic characteristics of river runoff generation from the pore to the catchment scale.

GLG821.name: Aqueous Geochemistry
GLG821.description: Controls on the chemical and isotopic nature of water (fresh, marine, brine) and its solutes. Data acquisition and synthesis. Chemical modeling and evolution of water masses.

GLG824.name: Stable Isotope Biogeochemistry
GLG824.description: Principles of stable isotope chemistry applied to biogeochemical problems

GLG850.name: From Research to Publication
GLG850.description: Moving research from data to publication including
GLG850.restrictions: Open to graduate students and open to juniors or seniors. Approval of department.

GLG862.name: Igneous Petrology
GLG862.description: Origin and evolution of magmatic systems. Relationship of igneous activity to tectonic setting.

GLG863.name: Mineral-Water Interactions
GLG863.description: Mineralogy, petrology and geochemistry of fluid-rock reactions in geologic, sedimentary and geochemical cycles. Rock and mineral weathering, soil formation, genesis and burial diagenesis of sediments and sedimentary rocks, and metamorphism.
GLG863.restrictions: Open only to graduate students in the Department of Crop and Soil Sciences or Department of Geological Sciences or Department of Geography.

GLG864.name: Mineral and Rock Physics
GLG864.description: Physical properties of rocks and minerals fundamental to understanding the structure and dynamics of the Earth and other planets for behavior, including elasticity, rheology, and thermal and electrical transport; theory, experimental measurement, and application to geophysical problems.

GLG873.name: Introduction to Numerical Tools for Earth and Environmental Scientists
GLG873.description: Introduction to Linux and C including numerical methods, integration, curve-fitting, and differential equations with an emphasis on applications to the geological sciences.

GLG889.name: Special Problems in GeocognItion
GLG889.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
GLG889.description: Individual study on current problems in geocognition and geoscience education research

GLG890.name: Special Problems in Planetary Geology and Astromaterials
GLG890.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
GLG890.description: Individual study on current topics in planetary geology and astromaterials, including meteorites and returned samples.
GLG890.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Earth and Environmental Sciences. Approval of department.

GLG891.name: Special Problems in Geochemistry
GLG891.description: Individual study on problems in geochemistry, including aqueous, biologic, and mineralogic aspects.
GLG891.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Earth and Environmental Sciences. Approval of department.

GLG892.name: Special Problems in Geophysics and Geodynamics
GLG892.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
GLG892.description: Individual study on problems in applied and solid-earth geophysics, global and regional geodynamics, and polar earth sciences.
GLG892.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Earth and Environmental Sciences. Approval of department.

GLG893.name: Special Problems in Hydrogeology
GLG893.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
GLG893.description: Individual study on the movement, occurrence and composition of groundwater in geologic environments.
GLG893.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Earth and Environmental Sciences. Approval of department.

GLG894.name: Special Problems in Paleobiology
GLG894.description: Individual study on invertebrate, vertebrate and plant paleobiology.
GLG894.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Earth and Environmental Sciences. Approval of department.

GLG895.name: Special Problems in Petrology
GLG895.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
GLG895.description: Individual study on current problems in petrology.
GLG895.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Earth and Environmental Sciences. Approval of department.

GLG896.name: Special Problems in Sedimentology and Stratigraphy
GLG896.description: Individual study on problems in sedimentology and stratigraphy.
GLG896.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Earth and Environmental Sciences. Approval of department.

GLG897.name: Special Problems in Structural Geology and Tectonics
GLG897.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
GLG897.description: Individual study on rock deformation or major expressions of deformation. From two to seven weeks of field study during semester breaks may be required for certain research projects.
GLG897.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Earth and Environmental Sciences. Approval of department.

GLG898.name: Special Problems in Environmental Geosociences
GLG898.description: Individual study on problems in environmental geosciences.
GLG898.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Earth and Environmental Sciences. Approval of department.

GLG899.name: Master's Thesis Research
GLG899.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Department of Earth and Environmental Sciences. Approval of department.

GLG900.name: Research Strategies and Methods in Environmental Engineering and Science
GLG900.description: Criteria for quality research, scientific method, scientific arguments, statistical testing, critical thinking skills, reviewing journal articles, literature synthesis, writing proposals and papers, giving presentations, responsible conduct of research.
GLG900.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Civil and Environmental Engineering and open to graduate students in the Department of Geological Sciences.

GLG901.name: Research Strategies and Methods
GLG901.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
GLG901.description: Selected topics in the earth and environmental sciences.

GLG999.name: Doctoral Dissertation Research
GLG999.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
GLG999.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the Department of Earth and Environmental Sciences. Approval of department.
